brandIdentity.designSummary: This brand design embodies a refined, minimalistic, and elegant aesthetic with a warm, neutral color palette dominated by a beige/taupe background and deep black text and UI elements. The layout is spacious and balanced, employing a strict grid with generous negative space to create a calm and sophisticated atmosphere. Typography features large, high-contrast serif headings paired with delicate serif body text, reinforcing a classic and timeless feel. The interface uses minimalistic buttons with thin borders and monochrome icons, emphasizing clarity and understated luxury. The overall visual personality is professional, warm, and inviting, suitable for premium service brands that value tradition and modernity.
brandIdentity.toneOfVoice: Sophisticated, calm, professional, refined, and trustworthy with a warm and inviting personality.

palette.paletteUsageGuide: Use the 'background' color as the primary canvas for most pages to create a warm and neutral environment. The 'primary' color is reserved for main text and key UI elements, ensuring strong readability and contrast. The 'secondary' color is used for dark backgrounds, such as booking sections, with 'secondaryForeground' for text to maintain accessibility. Buttons should use 'buttonBackground' for subtle fill with 'buttonBorder' for outlines, maintaining the minimalistic and elegant style. Avoid bright or saturated colors to preserve the sophisticated tone. Combine 'primary' and 'background' for text and backgrounds respectively to ensure clarity, and use 'secondary' backgrounds for emphasis or section differentiation.
palette.paletteAccessibilityNotes: The 'primary' color on 'background' provides excellent contrast exceeding WCAG AA standards for text readability. The 'secondary' background with 'secondaryForeground' text also meets WCAG AA contrast ratios, ensuring accessibility in darker sections. Button text on 'buttonBackground' with 'buttonBorder' outlines maintains sufficient contrast for interactive elements. Overall, the palette supports strong accessibility compliance across all UI components.

headings.headingsUsageGuide: Use the heading font for all primary titles and section headers to convey elegance and tradition. Pair with serif paragraph fonts for a cohesive look. Maintain ample spacing above and below headings to preserve clarity and hierarchy. Use 'primary' color for headings on light backgrounds and 'secondaryForeground' on dark backgrounds to ensure readability.
headings.headingsAccessibilityNotes: Headings in 'primary' color on 'background' meet WCAG AA contrast standards. On dark backgrounds, use 'secondaryForeground' for sufficient contrast.

paragraphs.paragraphsUsageGuide: Use the paragraph font for all body text and descriptive content. Maintain comfortable line height and letter spacing for readability. Pair with heading fonts to create a harmonious typographic hierarchy. Use 'primary' color for text on light backgrounds and 'secondaryForeground' on dark backgrounds to ensure accessibility.
paragraphs.paragraphsAccessibilityNotes: Body text in 'primary' color on 'background' meets WCAG AA contrast requirements. On dark backgrounds, use 'secondaryForeground' for sufficient contrast.

welcomeSectionTypography.implementation: The large heading is anchored in the top-left quadrant, spanning horizontally with ample negative space around it. Supporting text and call-to-action button are placed below the heading on the left side, balanced by images on the right. This creates a visually weighted layout that draws attention to the brand message while maintaining harmony and spaciousness.

components.containers: Containers use subtle backgrounds or none, relying on layout and spacing for structure. They maintain generous padding and margins to preserve the spacious and clean aesthetic. Background colors alternate between 'background' and 'secondary' to differentiate sections.
components.images: Images are high-quality, warm-toned, and natural, framed with generous spacing. They serve as visual anchors but their colors are not part of the brand palette. Images have no borders or shadows, maintaining a clean presentation.
components.buttons: Buttons are minimalistic with thin 'buttonBorder' outlines and 'buttonBackground' fill on hover or active states. Text uses 'primary' or 'secondaryForeground' depending on background. Buttons have generous padding and subtle rounded corners, consistent with the elegant style.

graphicElements.icons: Icons are simple, monochrome line style using 'primary' or 'secondaryForeground' colors. They are minimal and unobtrusive, supporting navigation and user interaction without distraction.
graphicElements.illustrations: No illustrations are present; the design relies on photography and typography for visual interest.
graphicElements.stickers: No stickers or badges are used, maintaining a clean and sophisticated look.

brandIdentity.designSummary: This design features a contemporary editorial style with a strong emphasis on large, geometric sans-serif typography and bold color blocking. The layout is modular and grid-based, balancing text and images with generous negative space and asymmetrical compositions. The color palette is warm and earthy, dominated by a bright red for emphasis, deep chocolate brown for grounding, muted beige as a neutral background, and mustard yellow for highlight areas. Typography hierarchy is clear with massive uppercase headings and light, readable body text. The overall aesthetic is minimal yet impactful, combining modernity with an artistic edge, suitable for creative and cultural brands.
brandIdentity.toneOfVoice: Confident, modern, artistic, and bold with a sophisticated yet approachable personality.

palette.paletteUsageGuide: Use the 'primary' color for key headings, call-to-action blocks, and emphasis elements to draw immediate attention. The 'primaryForeground' color should be used for text and icons placed on the 'primary' background to ensure clear readability. The 'secondary' color serves as a grounding tone for backgrounds, text blocks, and navigation elements, paired with 'secondaryForeground' for text to maintain contrast and warmth. The 'background' color provides a neutral, soft canvas that balances the stronger colors and supports content legibility. The 'highlightYellow' custom color is best used for large background sections or accent areas to create visual interest and break up the layout. Colors should be combined thoughtfully to maintain strong contrast and accessibility, with 'primary' and 'secondary' colors never used together without sufficient spacing or neutral buffer.
palette.paletteAccessibilityNotes: The 'primaryForeground' on 'primary' background meets WCAG AA standards for large text and AAA for normal text. The 'secondaryForeground' on 'secondary' background also meets WCAG AA contrast ratios for body text. The 'background' color paired with 'secondary' and 'primary' colors provides sufficient contrast for readability. The 'highlightYellow' should be used with 'secondary' or 'primaryForeground' text to maintain accessibility compliance.

headings.headingsUsageGuide: Use the heading font in large uppercase sizes to create strong visual hierarchy and impact. Pair with lighter paragraph fonts to maintain readability and balance. Maintain tight letter spacing for headings to preserve the bold, compact look. Ensure headings contrast strongly with background colors, preferably using 'primary' or 'secondary' colors with their respective foregrounds.
headings.headingsAccessibilityNotes: Headings using this font with 'primaryForeground' on 'primary' or 'secondaryForeground' on 'secondary' backgrounds meet WCAG AA contrast standards for all sizes.

paragraphs.paragraphsUsageGuide: Use the paragraph font in sentence case with moderate line height and letter spacing for comfortable reading. Pair with bold headings to create clear typographic contrast. Text color should primarily be 'secondary' or 'secondaryForeground' on 'background' to ensure legibility. Avoid using paragraph fonts in all caps to maintain readability.
paragraphs.paragraphsAccessibilityNotes: Paragraph text using 'secondary' on 'background' or 'secondaryForeground' on 'secondary' meets WCAG AA contrast ratios for body text.

welcomeSectionTypography.implementation: The welcome section uses a large, bold heading placed asymmetrically across the layout's quadrants, balancing text blocks with images and color blocks. This placement creates dynamic visual tension and guides the viewer's eye through the content. The typography is oversized and tightly spaced, emphasizing the brand's confident and modern tone.

components.containers: Containers are defined by solid color blocks or thin borders, creating clear separation between content areas. Background colors from the palette are used to differentiate sections, with ample padding to maintain clarity and focus.
components.images: Images are presented in clean rectangular frames, sometimes rotated or offset to add dynamism. They are integrated within color blocks or alongside text, maintaining balance and visual interest without overpowering the typography.
components.buttons: Buttons are minimal and rectangular with solid fills or outlines in the 'primary' color. Text on buttons uses 'primaryForeground' for contrast. Buttons maintain a clean, modern look consistent with the overall design.

graphicElements.icons: Icons are minimal, geometric, and monochromatic, typically using the 'secondaryForeground' or 'primaryForeground' colors to maintain visual harmony with the typography and color blocks.
graphicElements.illustrations: No illustrations are used; the design relies on photography and typography for visual storytelling.
graphicElements.stickers: No stickers or badges are present; emphasis is on clean, bold typography and color blocking.

brandIdentity.designSummary: The design features a minimalistic and modern aesthetic with a neutral, earthy color palette dominated by soft beige and warm taupe backgrounds. Accent colors in muted terracotta provide subtle warmth and sophistication. Typography is clean and geometric sans-serif, with bold headings and clear, readable body text that enhances clarity and elegance. The layout employs a modular grid with generous negative space, balancing text and imagery in well-defined blocks. Graphic elements are understated, including subtle horizontal lines that add structure without clutter. UI components such as buttons and icons are minimal and monochrome, supporting the overall clean and premium feel. This visual language conveys a sense of natural authenticity, calm confidence, and upscale simplicity, suitable for a variety of lifestyle and wellness brands.
brandIdentity.toneOfVoice: Calm, refined, and approachable with a professional and authentic personality that emphasizes natural beauty and premium quality.

palette.paletteUsageGuide: Use the 'background' color as the primary canvas for pages and large container areas to maintain a soft, neutral base. The 'secondary' color serves well for secondary containers or text backgrounds, providing subtle contrast without overpowering. The 'primary' color is ideal for key UI elements such as headings, lines, and accent details, bringing warmth and sophistication. Text should primarily use 'primaryForeground' or 'secondaryForeground' for maximum readability against their respective backgrounds. The 'warmAccent' color can be used sparingly for interactive elements like buttons or links to draw attention while maintaining harmony with the overall palette. The 'lineSeparator' color is specifically suited for subtle graphic lines and dividers, reinforcing structure without distraction. This palette ensures a balanced, accessible, and elegant visual experience.
palette.paletteAccessibilityNotes: The 'primaryForeground' black text on 'background' and 'secondary' colors meets WCAG AA contrast standards for body and heading text. The 'primary' color on 'background' also provides sufficient contrast for headings and accent text. The 'warmAccent' color used on 'background' or 'secondary' backgrounds maintains adequate contrast for interactive elements. The 'lineSeparator' color is used for non-textual graphic elements and does not require contrast compliance. Overall, the palette supports accessible typography and UI components across the site.

headings.headingsUsageGuide: Use the heading font in bold weights for primary titles and section headers to establish hierarchy and focus. Pair with the paragraph font for contrast, ensuring ample spacing and line height for readability. Headings should use the 'primary' color for emphasis or 'primaryForeground' on colored backgrounds. Maintain consistent letter spacing and avoid overly tight kerning to preserve clarity.
headings.headingsAccessibilityNotes: Headings in 'primary' color on 'background' or 'secondary' backgrounds meet WCAG AA contrast requirements. Use sufficient font size and weight to ensure legibility across devices.

paragraphs.paragraphsUsageGuide: Use the paragraph font in regular or medium weights for body text, captions, and secondary information. Text color should primarily be 'primaryForeground' or 'secondaryForeground' depending on background. Maintain comfortable line height and letter spacing to enhance readability. Combine with headings to create a clear typographic hierarchy and balanced page flow.
paragraphs.paragraphsAccessibilityNotes: Body text in 'primaryForeground' on 'background' or 'secondary' backgrounds meets WCAG AA contrast standards. Ensure font sizes are not too small to maintain accessibility.

welcomeSectionTypography.implementation: The welcome section uses a large, bold heading placed prominently in a modular grid block with ample negative space around it. The heading is left-aligned with supporting text below, creating a clear visual hierarchy. This placement emphasizes clarity and calmness, allowing the typography to breathe and draw attention without distraction.

components.containers: Containers use soft, neutral backgrounds with consistent padding and subtle borders or lines in 'lineSeparator' color to define sections without heavy visual weight. They maintain a clean and open feel, supporting content hierarchy and readability.
components.images: Images are presented without borders or shadows, integrated seamlessly into the grid. They maintain natural proportions and are balanced with text blocks to create visual interest while preserving the minimal aesthetic.
components.buttons: Buttons are minimal with subtle outlines or solid fills in 'warmAccent' color. Text on buttons uses 'primaryForeground' for clarity. Hover states may invert colors or increase saturation to indicate interactivity while maintaining elegance.

graphicElements.icons: Icons are simple, monochrome, and line-based, consistent with the minimal and modern style. They use 'primaryForeground' or 'warmAccent' colors to maintain visual harmony.
graphicElements.illustrations: No illustrations are present, supporting the clean and photographic focus of the design.
graphicElements.stickers: No stickers or badges are used, preserving the understated and sophisticated brand image.

brandIdentity.designSummary: The design features a minimalistic and spacious layout with a soft off-white background that creates a calm and neutral canvas. The primary color is a deep forest green used consistently for headings, text, icons, and buttons, conveying reliability and eco-consciousness. A lighter pastel green serves as a secondary color for backgrounds and highlights, adding freshness and subtle vibrancy. Typography combines a modern sans-serif font for headings with a monospaced or typewriter-style font for body text, emphasizing clarity and technical precision. The layout is balanced and column-based with generous white space, rounded corners on images and buttons, and a clean navigation system with pill-shaped buttons. Graphic elements are minimal and line-based, supporting the clean and professional aesthetic. Overall, the design communicates a harmonious blend of technology and sustainability, suitable for a wide range of industries focused on innovation and environmental responsibility.
brandIdentity.toneOfVoice: Professional, trustworthy, and forward-thinking with a focus on sustainability and innovation. The tone is calm, precise, and approachable, reflecting a brand that is both technologically advanced and environmentally conscious.

palette.paletteUsageGuide: Use the 'primary' color for all main text elements, headings, icons, and primary buttons to establish brand recognition and ensure readability. The 'secondary' color is ideal for backgrounds of interactive elements such as highlighted job listings and call-to-action buttons, providing a fresh and inviting contrast to the 'primary' color. The 'background' color should be used as the base canvas for pages to maintain a soft, neutral environment that reduces eye strain and enhances content focus. Text on 'primary' backgrounds should use 'primaryForeground' to ensure high contrast and accessibility, while text on 'secondary' backgrounds should use 'secondaryForeground' for clarity. Avoid mixing colors outside this palette to maintain brand consistency and a cohesive visual identity.
palette.paletteAccessibilityNotes: The 'primary' color (#0B3D2E) on the 'background' (#F5F5F0) provides excellent contrast exceeding WCAG AA standards for both normal and large text. Text in 'primaryForeground' (#FFFFFF) on 'primary' backgrounds also meets WCAG AA contrast requirements. The 'secondary' color (#C7E6C1) with 'secondaryForeground' (#0B3D2E) ensures sufficient contrast for readability on interactive elements. Overall, the palette supports accessible design for users with visual impairments and maintains legibility across devices.

headings.headingsUsageGuide: Use the heading font for all major titles and section headers to create a clear visual hierarchy. Italic styles can be applied selectively to emphasize key words or concepts, adding subtle dynamism without compromising readability. Pair headings with the monospaced paragraph font to balance modernity with technical precision. Maintain consistent spacing and avoid overcrowding to preserve the minimalistic aesthetic. Ensure headings use the 'primary' color for strong brand presence and accessibility.
headings.headingsAccessibilityNotes: Headings in 'primary' color on 'background' meet WCAG AA contrast standards, ensuring readability for users with visual impairments.

paragraphs.paragraphsUsageGuide: Use the paragraph font for all body text, captions, and smaller UI text to maintain clarity and a technical feel. The monospaced style supports the brand's technology focus and contrasts well with the sans-serif headings. Text should primarily use the 'primary' color on the 'background' for optimal readability. Maintain adequate line height and spacing to enhance legibility, especially for longer text blocks.
paragraphs.paragraphsAccessibilityNotes: Paragraph text in 'primary' color on 'background' meets WCAG AA contrast requirements, supporting accessible reading experiences.

welcomeSectionTypography.implementation: The welcome section places the headline and key messaging in the top third of the viewport, aligned left to create a natural reading flow. This placement is visually balanced by a large image on the right with rounded corners, creating a harmonious split layout. The typography uses large, bold headings with italic emphasis on key words to draw attention, supported by smaller, monospaced body text below. Generous white space surrounds the text, enhancing focus and readability while maintaining a clean, modern aesthetic.

components.containers: Containers use soft rounded corners and subtle background colors like 'secondary' for emphasis. They maintain consistent padding and margins to create a clean, organized structure. Borders are minimal or absent, relying on color and spacing for separation.
components.images: Images have rounded corners to soften the visual impact and integrate smoothly with the overall minimalistic design. They are balanced with text content and sized to maintain harmony within the grid layout.
components.buttons: Primary buttons use the 'primary' color with white text ('primaryForeground'), featuring rounded edges and a solid fill for clear call-to-action emphasis. Secondary buttons or less prominent actions use the 'secondary' background with 'secondaryForeground' text, often outlined or with subtle shadows to maintain hierarchy.

graphicElements.icons: Icons are minimal, line-based, and use the 'primary' color to maintain consistency and clarity. They are simple and functional, supporting navigation and interaction without distraction.
graphicElements.illustrations: No prominent illustrations are used; the design relies on realistic photography with natural colors, which are excluded from the core palette.
graphicElements.stickers: Stickers or badges, such as the 'Top 20' label, use the 'secondary' background with 'primary' text and rounded corners, maintaining the brand's clean and approachable style.

brandBook.toneOfVoice: Professional, trustworthy, and forward-thinking with a focus on sustainability and innovation. The tone is calm, precise, and approachable, reflecting a brand that is both technologically advanced and environmentally conscious.

components.images: Images have rounded corners to soften the visual impact and integrate smoothly with the overall minimalistic design. They are balanced with text content and sized to maintain harmony within the grid layout.
components.buttons: Primary buttons use the 'primary' color with white text ('primaryForeground'), featuring rounded edges and a solid fill for clear call-to-action emphasis. Secondary buttons or less prominent actions use the 'secondary' background with 'secondaryForeground' text, often outlined or with subtle shadows to maintain hierarchy.

Maintain adequate line height and spacing to enhance legibility, especially for longer text blocks.

initialPrompt: A simple website for a Meesho seller to showcase products. Each product name links directly to its Meesho page. The seller can add and manage products easily.
